metadata.title: Cows and capitalism: humans, animals and machines in West German barns, 1950-80
metadata.journal_or_publisher: European Review of History: Revue europ√©enne d'histoire

relevance.topic: The impact of mechanization on labor displacement in West German dairy farming.
relevance.relevance: The study examines the displacement of agricultural workers due to the introduction of milking machines in West German barns, highlighting the broader implications of mechanization on labor and economic practices.

design.sample_characteristics: Focus on West German dairy farming sector.

dependent_variables.displaced: Former agricultural workers replaced by milking machines.
dependent_variables.wage_changes: Wages reduced due to financial stress from low milk prices.

text_fragments: 'The milking machine replaced not only unavailable milkers by maximizing productivity and therein the number of milked cows per hour.'
'Mechanization did not depreciate the animals' position in the work process.'
qualitative_data.narrative_descriptions: The study describes the transformation of West German dairy farming from manual labor to mechanized production, highlighting the interplay between humans, animals, and machines.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Post-war economic growth and industrialization in West Germany.
historical_context.institutional_context: State market regulation and subsidy systems in agriculture.

outcomes.main_findings: The mechanization of milking led to the displacement of agricultural workers, transforming dairy farming into a mechanized, profit-oriented industry.
outcomes.conclusions: Mechanization in West German barns resulted in labor displacement and economic transformation, challenging traditional capitalist narratives.
outcomes.long_term_impacts: The study suggests that mechanization altered the societal function of cows and milk, influencing migration patterns and economic practices.

quality_assessment.methodological_limitations: The study relies on historical sources, which may not capture all aspects of the mechanization process.
quality_assessment.coherence: The study provides a consistent narrative of the impact of mechanization on labor and economic practices.
quality_assessment.adequacy_of_data: The study uses a variety of historical sources, including agricultural journals and instructional films, to support its findings.
quality_assessment.relevance: The study is relevant to understanding the impact of technological change on labor displacement in agriculture.
